ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I greatly increased my knowledge of Russian grammar, especially verbs of motion. I also expanded my vocabulary, and now feel comfortable using the cases. This class also helped me improve my speaking and reading skills.
Greatly improved my knowledge of Russian grammar and my comfort with speaking the language.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Good professor but the coursework is difficult.

This course was very strong in the way that grammar was taught--I really understood each concept before we moved on, but we didn't spend so long on one thing that I was bored. Although we spoke a lot, we may have read out of the textbook a little too much during class; it would be nice to do more informal exercises to practice grammar concepts rather than reading straight out of the textbook (even though this would be more difficult). Overall, I thought the course was very well taught, it just would have been nice to try speaking outside of scripted dialogue a little more.
The workload is high enough that it is occasionally redundant. Besides that, the class is designed very well to teach students at a fast pace.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes but they should know the amount of work it is.

I would recommend this course, but only to people who are not afraid of a challenge. Russian is very difficult, and Russian grammar is very complex. Although they taught it very well and in a really understandable way, there is still a lot to keep track of, and if you start to slack off you can fall way behind. But it was a fun course, and it definitely helped me improve way more quickly than I was expecting to.
Yes. The class is very well designed and the instructors are quite dedicated.
